title: ExecuteResponse
description: This intent is triggered to provide commands to execute on smart home devices. The new state should be provided in the response if available. One triggered intent can target multiple devices, with multiple commands. For example, a triggered intent may set both brightness and color on a set of lights or may set multiple lights each to a different color.

errorCode.description: An error code for the entire transaction for auth failures and developer system unavailability. For individual device errors, use the errorCode within the device object.

debugString.description: Detailed error which will never be presented to users but may be logged or used during development.

commands.description: Each object contains one or more devices with response details. N.B. These may not be grouped the same way as in the request. For example, the request might turn 7 lights on, with 3 lights succeeding and 4 failing, thus with two groups in the response.

ids.description: List of device IDs corresponding to this status.

oneOf.description: Command is enqueued but expected to succeed.
Target device is in offline state or unreachable.
There is an issue or alert associated with a command. The command could succeed or fail. This status type is typically set when you want to send additional information about another connected device.
Target device is unable to perform the command.

states.description: Aligned with per-trait states described in each trait schema reference. These are the states after execution, if available.

online.description: Indicates if the device is online (that is, reachable) or not.

errorCode.description: Expanding ERROR state if needed from the preset error codes, which will map to the errors presented to users.

challengeNeeded.description: A response that requires a Secondary user verification challenge.
